questions.question: What is the time at event A?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Look closer at the message from process 2 to 4
explanations.c: Incorrrect. Take the ticking of each process into account.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Messages carry the latest version of time after the event has been incremented

questions.question: Taking the same diagram from the previous question, is the distributed system consistent?

explanations.a: Incorrect. There are no cycles to be found in this system
explanations.b: Correct. There are no deadlocks in this system

questions.question: In the diagram from Q1, what is the vector time at B?

explanations.a: Incorrect. Messages carry the latest version of time after the event has been incremented.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Messages carry the latest version of time after the event has been incremented. Also, process 4 ticks at a rate of 4.
explanations.c: Incorrrect. Take the ticking of each process into account.

questions.question: What is the relation between events A and B?

explanations.a: Correct. A ≮ B, A ≯ B and A ≠ B
